results.title: The Other way
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents the ideas of E.F. Schumacher, a British economist who is deeply concerned with dwindling fuel supplies, myths about modern technology, and the loss of human worth in 20th-century consumer production. Emphasises his idea that many modern machines use too much energy and that there is a need to develop an intermediate technology of machines that consume less energy. Commentary by Ian Holm.

results.title: The Other Thailand
results.creator_credit: Alan Bateman, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This program, presented by Keith Adam, describes the southern area of Thailand where the majority of the people are Muslim. It explores the industries in the area and the conflicts with the northern Buddhist population.

results.title: The Other son
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, AFTRS and Heng Tang
results.brief_description: Vera is the meticulous wife, mother and reigning matriarch of her palatial home. She manages her domestic domain with digital clockwork precision. It is 7pm and dinner time. Her dutiful husband and beautiful son take their designated places at the table. However, the tranquillity is interrupted by the sudden appearance of an intruder threatening to shatter Vera’s utopia. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: The Other sister
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Mario Iscovich, Alex Rose and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: When a mentally challenged young woman returns home from an institution, she craves independence not willingly granted by her loving but overprotective mother. After meeting a mentally handicapped man, Carla experiences romance and the desire for a life unencumbered by others’ limited expectations of her. Cast includes Juliette Lewis, Diane Keaton, Tom Skerritt, Giovanni Ribisi, Poppy Montgomery, Juliet Mills.

results.title: The Other side of the coin = Il Rovescio della medaglia
results.brief_description: Documentary film about post World War II Italian migrants living in somewhat depressed circumstances in Sydney. A group of Italian men discuss their situations since arriving in Australia, the discrimination, their inability to obtain a decent paying job no matter how skilled they are, their inadequate living conditions and lack of money and education, and the threat of deportation if their political beliefs (particularly those of socialist/communist persuasion) are too radical in the minds of the incumbent Liberal government (1978) whose politics of assimilation appear to be the driving force. Loneliness and alienation are part of daily existence amongst the migrant community, more so with the older generation as their children having been taught English at school, refuse to speak Italian at home. There appears to be a sense of a loss of culture and language contrary to the perception that post-war Australia is made up of a multilingual and multicultural society. The background story to the film which provides the basis for discussion about migrant rights is the deportation in 1978 of a radical community worker, Ignazio Salemi. Includes archival footage of Italian labourers working the Queensland cane fields during the 1950s.

results.title: The Other side of the coin
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Stephen Ramsey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
It’s hard in an affluent society to make do just on the pension. A couple show how they manage- what they do without and their wry but courageous philosophy of life.

results.title: The Other side
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Zaljko Radic
results.brief_description: A 3D animation without dialogue. Kids will love this simple story with a Jules Verne influence. A moustached man in a brightly coloured flying machine travels through a surreal futuristic landscape searching for a lost city…Created using Lightwave, After FX and Premiere

results.title: The Other olympians
results.creator_credit: Ian Lang, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Andrew Wiseman
results.brief_description: A documentary which examines the training procedures of two paraplegic athletes preparing for the Olympics for the Disabled staged in the Netherlands in 1980. Also covers the rehabilitation period of a young man who has only recently been left paralysed as the result of an accident. Narrated by Phillip Adams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Lang, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Andrew Wiseman
